products at stores craft shows and online but if you sell online please credit me 3 special instructions chain 1 and chain 2 at the beginning of the row do not count as a stitch the first stitch is always worked into the same stitch as the join all rounds end by joining with a slip_stitch to the first stitch unless otherwise stated on the join s marked with a ** **join you will join with an invisible slip_stitch to the first stitch of the round to complete this join after you have made your final stitch of the round pull your loop up a little take your hook out and place it backward through the first stitch of the round place your yarn on the hook tighten it down and pull it through the first stitch then turn your work to face you and continue crocheting as normal this minimizes the seam you can watch this video by bella coco crochet beginning at mark 1 14 if you want to skip the intro to learn how to do this**join https //www youtube com/watch v=vrf_dbitdrs&t=74s there is also a photo tutorial on page 10 sizing this pattern is written for sizes preschooler child and average adult and should fit an average sized head for those sizes at the end of this pattern i have included the hat size chart that i used to determine sizing you can use this as a guide to make more sizes if need be this cap was designed to sleep in so it is supposed to fit snug gauge for this pattern is 8 double_crochet s and 4 row = 2 inches if you are having an issue reaching gauge try going up or down a hook size none of us crochet the same measure your beanie before you finish off if it is too long or too short you can always remove or add additional rounds leesa nixon aka leesa s knotty corner ©2020-2021 this pattern is for personal use only it may not be copied reproduced edited
